## What is R?

## 

## Installation

## R

## RStudio

### Structure of the RStudio interface

#### Script Pane

#### Console


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
"Hello World!"
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Hello World!"
```
:::
:::


Tadaa, we just wrote our first line of code.

## First Steps

Some of the most basic things you can do in `R` is are basic mathematical operations. In your `Console`

type the following code lines and press `Enter`.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# sum
1 + 2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 3
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# substract
2 - 4
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] -2
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# multiply
4 * 4
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 16
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# divide
3/2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1.5
```
:::
:::


By the way: Code lines, that are preceded by a `#` are commented out, and will not be evaluated.

## 4 Workflow

When only coding in our `Console`, we quickly run into the question where to save our code for further evaluation.
